    • Method Detail

      • setSelectionRoot

        public void setSelectionRoot(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path rootPath)
        Specify the selection root for a directory scan, if any. Used to populate partition columns. Also, specify the maximum partition depth.
        Parameters:
        rootPath - Hadoop file path for the directory
        partitionDepth - maximum partition depth across all files within this logical scan operator (files in this scan may be shallower)

      • setPartitionDepth

        public void setPartitionDepth(int partitionDepth)

      • setFiles

        public void setFiles(List<org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path> files)

      • useLegacyWildcardExpansion

        public void useLegacyWildcardExpansion(boolean flag)
        Indicates whether to expand partition columns when the query contains a wildcard. Supports queries such as the following:
         select * from dfs.`partitioned-dir`
         In which the output columns will be (columns, dir0) if the partitioned directory has one level of nesting. See TestImplicitFileColumns#testImplicitColumns

      • useLegacyExpansionLocation

        public void useLegacyExpansionLocation(boolean flag)
        In legacy mode, above, Drill expands partition columns whenever the wildcard appears. Drill 1.1 - 1.11 put expanded partition columns after data columns. This is actually a better position as it minimizes changes the row layout for files at different depths. Drill 1.12 moved them before data columns: at the location of the wildcard.

        This flag, when set, uses the Drill 1.12 position. Later enhancements can unset this flag to go back to the future: use the preferred location after other columns.
